intro: Argyrolobium stenophyllum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved silver globular veldt, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its typical pod-bearing fruits and nitrogen-fixing capabilities. The plant is notable for its dense, spherical clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in spring. Its leaves are narrow and often silver-haired, contributing to its striking appearance in its natural habitat. It thrives in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments.
